topic.title: Packing and Deploying Frameworks as Add-ons

body.p: In , custom framework can be packed and deployed as an add-on.

section.title: Packing a Framework as an Add-on
section.p:
This procedure is suitable for developers who want a better control over the add-on package or those who want to automate some of the steps:
Pack the full custom framework (or an extension of a framework) as a ZIP file or a Java Archive. Note that you should pack the entire root directory not just its contents.

section.title: Alternate Packing Method: Add-ons Packager
section.p:
Alternatively, you can use the Add-ons Packager plugin by following this procedure:
Go to Help Install new add-ons to open an add-on selection dialog box.
Enter or paste https://www.oxygenxml.com/InstData/Addons/optional/updateSite.xml in the Show add-ons from field.
Select the Add-ons Packager add-on and click Next.
Select the I accept all terms of the end user license agreement option and click Finish.
Restart the application.
Result: If the add-on is correctly installed, the Add-ons packager toolbar action is available.
Invoke the Add-ons packager toolbar action and input the required information in the displayed dialog box.
Click OK to complete the packaging process.
